content.description:
P1: Follow the corner crack to gear belay

P2: Traverse the cleft leftwards to ledge/anchor. This starts with 3 bolts. Crux is getting to the 2nd bolt. May be harder than 5.9 getting into the cleft for larger (big-shouldered) climbers. Ditch the helmet for sure.

P3: Follow a catwalk and face to top anchor.

Memorable 2nd pitch.
content.location: The obvious and ominous cleft thru a big roof.

content.description:
P1: Short 1st pitch. Awkward clip at 1st bolt. This short face collects dirt/moss and is perhaps an unpleasant crux.

P2: 3 star crack climbing. Starting fingers then widening to hands. 2 bolts protect a thin section in the middle. A final bolt leads left to ledge/anchor.
content.location: A fairly obvious crack climb to the right.

content.description:
P1; Corner/crack to gear belay.

P2 The long hand traverse starts with 3 bolts. Brace yourself for a runout getting to 2nd bolt, crux. The last part takes gear. Belay with a long sling so you can keep watch of your partner on the traverse.

P3: Up hand crack then traverse right to Eclipse anchor.

Note: This was led on sight. Bolts placed on lead, one-handed.
content.location: The intimidating roof traverse just right of the ominous cleft.
